description: Does not save any information to the disk. Complete waste of time. Use eartag instead.
It took a couple of tries to get the hang of it, but once I did it works great. It's easy once you figure it out, especially for working multiple tracks.
Identifies tracks. Downloads cover art. Allows you to choose exactly how you want to tag every track. Strongly recommended.

wow i'm impressed! it does nothing!
would have given it 0 stars if possible

The application itself is excellent. However, if you're using the Flatpak you are limited to where your music is stored by the sandboxing. I have my data disks and NFS shares located in /mnt which isn't accessible by the Flatpak version. Hopefully, they change that in the future.
i've used it for years, never had a problem. it does something, definitely ;)
If you have an unorganized music library, this is the application for you.
love it strongly recommend

I use this and Puddletag. I love MusicBrainz because it automates the search and tagging including album covers. 4 stars because the interface is not the most intuitive and the settings need to handled with care to provide a balance between accurate results and garbage. Using accurate results settings I typically tag 50-75% of my music. That might just be a reflection of my music tastes but it means it cannot be relied on to do everything but what it does it does well.
summary: One of the best automatic taggers out there

description: Awful at matching the tracks; Always matches wrong, even when I set the tags perfectly it wanted to change them, and has no way of showing if it's doing something or not.

I have tried several others and not gotten the results I expected. So many of my albums/CDs are OLD or out of print and many are hard to find. This tool connects to a comprehensive online library to identify music in many forms and allows you to permanently tag and organize your music collection.

It takes work - it's not just "press a button and it's done" because the tools that work that way usually get it WRONG. If you take the time and follow the instructions, you'll be richly rewarded by this application - Thanks to the authors for creating it!!
summary: Excellent Music Search and Tag Tool - EXTREMELY helpful!!

description: greatly improved my MP3 tags
summary: a must have for labeling MP3s

description: I recently decided to grab all the music I've collected from sources over the years and add them all to my Plex server. A ton of my library was mis-matched years ago by a winamp plugin and all my meta data was wrecked. I gave up back then, but now using Picard I finally have everything labeled correctly with all the missing information added. It took some manual work still, but Picard helped A TON. I love it!
summary: Finally have my library all together

description: I can only access files on local drive. If I try to go to /media/randy, the slashes aren't allowed......
summary: Cannot access media files on plug in 1 TB drive

description: Theoretically useful app; badly packaged snap. Worse, there's no issue tracker.

I dual boot linux (and Windows) off a SSD, and have put data (especially static data which doesn't need to be backed up daily) on separate physical and logical drives - including 2TB of media files on a HDD which is automatically mounted in /media. 

Picard shows /media as empty. 

I could understand an argument that bulk updating on network drives impacts the network ... but ignoring local non-root drives ???
summary: Can only see files on root disk

description: Frustrating beyond belief. It pollutes music with superfluous spam data that cannot be removed and refuses to add pertinent data to needed files.
Used to use this on Ubuntu 14.04. Upgraded to 20.04 and the latest version just doesn't start. shame really, as it was a really useful program.

I installed this on Ubuntu 20. I tried dragging files onto the left pane but nothing happened. I clicked the 'Add Files' button and it closed. I tried that repeatedly with the same results. Waste of my time.
Best app ever .. saved me over 3 days of manual tagging ID3 tages
yay, it is a good experience lol
Don't waste your time

I though it was broken because I couldn't get it to work, but I was just using it wrong, you can look tutorials online, it not really intuitive, believe me.
if the ui and wording was clearer it could get a 5 stars, but for now... it's OK if you have the patience
This program can wrangle even the most jumbled music libraries!
summary: The best way to tag your music

description: Can't access my second HDD that I have my music library in, even though it is mounted.
waste of time, doesn't mount anything other than root drive

Very customizable tool to clean up your music file's tags and filenames.

If you install via Flatpak and Snap note that there are restrictions on the accessible file locations due to the sandboxing. With Flatpak you can add additional paths via command line, with Snap you are restricted to the home folder and what Snap considers removable media.
summary: Keeps my music collection tidy for years

description: I've used Picard for many years to update and correct tags. For those complaining, I keep my music files on an external drive and the app works fine accessing external media.
Install it using the command line without this snap stuff. Permission errors all over the place, especially for mounted drives.
The interface for this app is completely illogical and makes it very easy to obliterate your music collection.
To be honest, it's bad... tried it with 3 albums... crashed on every album... never to try again.
Overcomplicated and doesn't do the job. The two albums it found didn't even have the same number of tracks as the album I gave it!

Just doesn't seem to see 1000's of tracks, halts scanning with no indication what's wrong. Interface is way over complicated if you just want to find album art. Difficult to find any online help due to application title triggering masses of star treck references.
summary: Only scanned 32 albums out of a 300+ album collection

description:
This software serves a specific purpose, and does so well. I guess underneath we're really just using coreutils and some other userapce binaries (like I said, a guess).

I have used it successfully on ~150GB of audio files, re-sorting folders and files to just the way I want it. As always, a fool with a tool is still a fool. I recommend running some testing before doing re-architecting you whole "production" data filesystem/s.

It is a brilliant tool when you use it properly. The tagging and other lookup tools work very well and the scriptable API allows for any amount of customisation of file and folder structure.

wanted a GUI front end for rsgain, but this UX in not intutive at all

it may do what i wanted to do, but how to do it was not at all obvious.... i just use the command line instead.
Wirklich sehr gutes Produk!
summary: Läuft super und auch in Lollypop eingebunden!

description: zuverlässig und arbeitet stabil. man muss sich erst in den ganzen einstellungen etwas ein fuchsen aber mit der zeit klappt es auch.

Erlaubt sogar das Einbetten von Cover-Bildern.
Ich habe lange so ein Tool für Linux gesucht.

ich kenne kein besseres grafisches Tool um meine Musikbibliothek zu verwalten. Damit ist Picard der erste Schritt in die Welt der MusicBrainz Comunity. Bald weis man nicht mehr wie man seine Sammlung vorher organisieren konnte.

Rápida y cómoda.
Una completa aplicación para etiquetar con facilidad tus pistas de música

Usando Elisa y VLC, y si se quiere usar cualquier otro reproductor, los archivos de audio deben tener la minuatura incluida. Yo tenía mucho de mi biblioteca sin esa imagen, por lo que no quedaba tan estético. Aprendí a añadirlas por lotes con MusicBrainz Picard y ahora lo tengo perfecto. Encantado de haberlo conocido.
Pude ordenar mis archivos de música, cambiar los nombres, corregir metadatos (nombres de artistas) y crear álbumes. Todo rápido, sencillo. ¡Excelente app!
Buena aplicacion
Une base de données très fournie et un outil d'édition de masse très puissant
summary: Le meilleur éditeur de tags disponible

description: testé avec plusieurs morceaux connus/ peu connus/ trés connus trés peu de résultats justes, beaucoup de résultats fantaisistes (morceaux de rap pris pour du classique new age par exemple) .
Ne fait pas ce qu'il dit dans la description tout ce qu'il fait c'est montrer l'album d'ou provient la chanson.

Je n'arrive pas à ouvrir mes fichiers audio, pourtant sur une partition NTFS montée régulièrement...

Quid???
summary: Bof, pas convaincu par cette version 2.7.1

description:
Outil d'édition de masse très puissant.
La reconnaissance automatique fonctionne bien.
La base de titres est très grande et on y retrouve même des morceaux peu populaires. 
Ceux qui disent qu'il ne fait pas ce qui est annoncé ne savent probablement pas s'en servir !
Не всегда корректно идентифицирует (а иногда и не идентифицирует вовсе), но в целом хорошая задумка и вполне достойная реализация.
Давно пользуюсь, этой программой. Хорошо распознает, не без ошибок конечно, но бОльшую часть библиотеки приведет в правильный вид
